description: Implied warranty of habitability in used home sale
facts: Quinn bought a 40-year-old home from Rachel
Rachel is not a builder or developer, just an individual seller
The basement leaks during heavy rain
The sale contract included an 'as-is' clause that Quinn signed
Quinn inspected the property before purchase
asp_facts: property_claim(claim9). claimant(claim9, quinn). respondent(claim9, rachel). claim_type(claim9, warranty_habitability). property_type(claim9, house). construction_type(claim9, existing_home). seller_type(claim9, individual). home_age_years(claim9, 40). defect_type(claim9, basement_leak). as_is_clause(claim9, yes). buyer_inspection(claim9, yes).
question: Can Quinn recover against Rachel for the basement leak?
rationale: The implied warranty of habitability typically applies only to new construction by builder-vendors. In sales of existing homes by individual sellers with an as-is clause and buyer inspection, caveat emptor applies and Quinn cannot recover.
